data.title: Tenafly Railroad Station
meta_keywords: New Jersey Historic Preservation Bond Program
data.meta_description: Tenafly Railroad Station, New Jersey Historic Trust, New Jersey Historic Preservation Bond Program
data.text:
Designed in 1872 by prominent architect Daniel Topping Atwood, the station is a prominent community landmark that recalls Tenafly's genesis as a fashionable commuter suburb. Its use declined after the opening of the George Washington Bridge, and the station closed in 1966.

The grant funded the restoration of the train station to its original appearance, including reconstruction of the canopy and conservation of sandstone walls.
